headline: Why Oil Prices Are Slow to Reflect Gulf Turmoil
abstract: The muted initial reaction to last week’s killing of an Iranian general points to confidence that shipping lanes will be unaffected.
lead_paragraph: The most surprising thing about the oil market’s initial response to the American killing of an Iranian general, Qassim Suleimani, was that it appeared to be so muted. Although prices jumped soon after the killing, the upward momentum quickly eased.
